alert.note: Alert for Sumner (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 30 at 2:47PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Sumner County through 315 PM CDT... At 246 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Goodlettsville, or 12 miles west of Gallatin, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Gallatin, Hendersonville, Goodlettsville, White House and Millersville. This includes Interstate 65 between mile markers 98 and 102. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
